700425f-a.text:
Arlington Ave., west side, between West 254th and West 256th Streets, showing a brick stable on the former G.P. Morisini estate. The view is northward from within the grounds. The G.W. Bromley map of 1893 shows this building to have been part of the Martin Bates estate.
April 24, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

700426f-b.text:
(1)
Arlington Ave., west side, between West 254th and West 258th Streets (vantage-point,not seen). The view is in a northeasterly direction, showing part of the stable (left), and greenhouses on the former estate
of G.P. Morisini.
April 24, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
Aeo Ne 2 1
(2)
The same, another view.
April 24, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

700384f-a.text:
West 254th Street (foreground, not seen), north side, between Arlington and Blackstone Aves. The view is in a northerly direction
showing a road within the G.P. Morisini estate.
April 24, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
N2g N. 2

700383f-b.text:
(1)
West 254th Street, east from Arlington Ave. On the north side of the street (left), is the land of the former G.P. Morisini
estate.
April 24, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The north side of the street as viewed eastward from Netherland
Ave.
April 24, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

in a southerly direction.
